availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Woolfolk and N. Woolfolk. Married Elizabeth Woolfolk. Father of Harriett A. Woolfolk, Austin T. Woolfolk, Nannie B. Woolfolk, and Sarah Woolfolk. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 266. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts, p. 66. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Milburn, p. 9. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Milburn, District 7, p. 34. Find A Grave, "Augustin Woolfolk (1825-1872)," Memorial #139734840, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=139734840&ref=acom (accessed June 23, 2017).
